Toyohashi Curry Udon has a different feature from regular Curry Udon, which is that there is rice and yam at the bottom of the bowl of Curry Udon.
Curry udon tends to leave some of the roux behind as you eat the udon.
The idea was born from the thoughtful consideration that the roux tends to remain after the udon is eaten, so that the udon can be enjoyed until the very end.
